definitions.definition: relating to the examination and treatment of patients and their illnesses

examples.text: clinical research *(= done on patients, not just considering theory)*
clinical training *(= the part of a doctor’s training done in a hospital)*
She regarded her patients from a purely clinical standpoint.

definitions.definition: cold and calm and without feeling or sympathy

examples.text: He watched her suffering with clinical detachment.
How can you be so cold and clinical about your son’s accident?
Everything in the nursery was white and clinical and there were no pictures on the walls.

wordOrigin: late 18th cent.: from Greek klinikē ‘bedside’, from klinē ‘bed’. + -al.
